Articles.Content: So I've always had issues landing rovers. I was always sticking the Rover under or over my lander. To solve the problem, I launched an airplane cargo bay with the Rover inside. I had it sitting pointed up so when landed i could just tip the bay over and drive out. It worked great, I didn't need any clunky rockets on the Rover and it really cuts down on the drag when your launching.
I think this should be under general discussion, not gameplay questions. But it is a good idea.

Looks like a tutorial to me so it's in the right place.

Could have used pics to demonstrate it though.
